text: Which of the following is the dimension for impulse?
explanation:
Impulse = Force \(\times\) time
Force has the dimension \(\frac{ML}{T^{2}}\), hence
Impulse= \(\frac{ML}{T^{2}} \times T = \frac{ML}{T}\)

text: A body accelerates uniformly from rest at 2\(ms^{-2}\). Calculate its velocity when it has travelled a distance of 9m.
explanation:
Given that \(u = 0ms^{-1}, a = 2ms^{-2}, s = 9m\)
We can use the equation, \(v^{2}=u^{2} +2as\) so that we have,
\(v^{2} = 0^{2} + 2\times 2\times 9\)
\(v^{2} = 36; v= 6.0ms^{-1}\)
Note; u = Initial velocity
v = final velocity
a = acceleration
s = distance covered

text: A body weighing 14N in air is partially immersed in water. If the mass of water displaced in the process is 200g, calculate the upthrust on the body. [g=10\(m/s^{2}\)]
explanation:
Upthrust = weight of liquid displaced
= mass of liquid displaced \(\times\) acceleration due to gravity
= \(\frac{200}{1000} \times 10\)
= 2N

text: A motorist travelling at 72\(kmh^{-1}\) had his eyes shut for 0.4s during a hard sneeze. Calculate the distance covered by him during this time interval.
explanation:
Convert velocity from \(kmh^{-1}\) to \(ms^{-1}\), by multiplying \(\frac{1000}{3600}\),
\(72 \times \frac{1000}{3600}\) = \(20ms^{-1}\)
Therefore, distance covered in 0.4s =  \(20 \times 0.4 = 8m\)

text: The energy stored in a spring of stiffness constant k = 2000\(Nm^{-1}\) when extended 4cm is
explanation:
The spring constant = the measure of stiffness = 2000\(Nm^{-1}\)
Energy stored in a spring = Work done to stretch it through a distance = change in potential energy
= \(\frac{kx^{2}}{2}\) = \(\frac{2000 \times (0.04)^{2}}{2}\) (converting 4cm to metres)
= \(\frac{3.2}{2} = 1.60J\)

text: Ice of mass 50g at 0°C was completely melted by 70% of the total heat energy supplied. Calculate the total heat energy supplied  [Specific latent heat of fusion of ice = 336\(Jg^{-1}\)]
explanation:
The quantity of heat needed to melt ice = mL (where m is the mass of ice and L is the specific latent heat of fusion of ice)
Q = \(50 \times 336 = 16800J\) but this is 70% of the total heat supplied so that we have,
70% total heat = 16800J
\(\frac{70}{100}\) of total heat = 16800J
⇒ Total heat supplied = \(\frac{16800\times100}{70} = 24000J\)

text: A plane is inclined at an angle \(\theta\) to the horizontal. Its velocity ratio is
explanation:

text: The diagram above illustrates a beaker of water being heated. It is observed that as the bubbles rise they get bigger in size.The reason for this observation is

options.A: water pressure on the bubbles decreases
options.B: density of water increases with rise in temperature
options.C: volume of water increases with rise in temperature
options.D: atmospheric pressure on the bubbles decreases

explanation: When a bubble is deep under water, it has both atmospheric pressure and water pressure (giving it depth), acting on it but as it rises, the water pressure decreases. At this point, the basic pressre acting on the bubble is the atmospheric pressure. Recall that pressure is inversely proportional to volume (Boyles' law), hence, the less the pressure, the more the volume.

text: Two plane mirrors are inclined at an angle 20° to each other. Determine the number of images formed when an object is placed between them.
explanation:
The number of images formed = \(\frac{360}{n}\) where the value gotten is odd
else, = \(\frac{360}{n} -1\).
Solving, we have that \(\frac{360}{20} = 18\)
Hence, the no of images formed is 18 - 1 = 17.

text: A converging lens of focal length 10cm forms an erect image three times the size of the real object. Calculate the distance between the image and the object.
explanation:
Given, image size = 3U
object size = U
focal length = 10cm
lens to object distance = \(\frac{focal length \times object size}{image size}\)
= \(\frac{10 \times u}{3u} = 3.33\)
distance between image and object = 10 + 3.33 = 13.33cm
